9890631.diomed: A few of these look as though they would prefer an extra furlong but not ENCHANTED LINDAp, a consistent filly who has been running well.

horses.breedingComment: Third foal; half-sister to Group-placed 7f-1m2f winner Kings Gift (inc 2yo; RPR 104) and US 8.3f dirt winner Al Musaddad; dam 10.8f winner (stayed 2m; 85), closely related to Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner Jaish (stayed 1m2f) out of sister to Sakhee
horses.sireComment: impressive Coventry Stakes winner at 2, outstanding miler at 3-4; lots of 2yo winners in first crop
horses.diomedComment: Back in calmer waters and ground should suit, but another furlong possibly preferable.
horses.spotlight: Unraced as a 2yo, but did well in her first season including wins at Ripon (6f, good) and Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) last summer; back to form on second start of this year when runner-up at Redcar (5f, good to firm), but probably found the soft ground against her at York three weeks ago when behind Society Queen; ground should suit but suspicion that 6f is better.

horses.breedingComment: 180,000gns F; 5th foal; half-sister to winners Extortionist (5f inc 2yo/Group 3; RPR 115), Utterly Charming (5f 2yo; 74) and Knight's Dream (US 8.5f); dam 7f AW winner (80), out of 6f 2yo Listed) winning half-sister to 1m2f Listed winner Foodbroker Fancy
horses.sireComment: useful 6-7f; dam won French Oaks; closely related to Invincible Spirit; leading source of speed
horses.diomedComment: Remains unexposed, but not sure return to 5f is in her favour on turf/handicap debut.
horses.spotlight: Impressive when off the mark on her second start at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) in November, but no impact on her reappearance in a Listed event over the same C&D in May; remains unexposed but not sure return to 5f is in her favour on turf/handicap debut.

horses.breedingComment: E180,000 Y; second foal; dam French 7f-7.5f winner, half-sister to 6.5f Group 1 winner Signs Of Blessing, is granddaughter of Listed-placed 1m4f winner
horses.sireComment: useful 6-7f; dam won French Oaks; closely related to Invincible Spirit; leading source of speed
horses.diomedComment: Return to 5f and better ground may help; worth considering
horses.spotlight: First three starts on the AW, making a successful reappearance at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) in April but finishing behind Fen Breeze and Raheeb when last of 13 in a Listed contest at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) in May; ran too free when a well-held fourth of five on her turf/handicap debut at Goodwood (6f, soft) last month but return to 5f and better ground may help, so has to be respected.

horses.breedingComment: Second foal; half-sister to 1m1f-1m6f winner Ship Of The Fen (inc 2yo; RPR 91); dam 9.4f AW winner (77), half-sister to 1m1f Group 3 winner Monarch's Glen out of US 1m Grade 3 winning half-sister to French Oaks/Moulin winner Nebraska Tornado
horses.sireComment: High-class sprinter; four time Group 1 runner-up, won Temple Stakes; half-brother to Cityscape
horses.diomedComment: Down in grade, but may again find things happening too quickly for her.
horses.spotlight: First three starts all over 6f on the Chelmsford Polytrack, winning on debut in February and only going down narrowly under her penalty in April, but only making modest late gains when seventh of 13 in a Listed contest in May (Raheeb and Lufricia behind); drop to 5f did her few favours when when well held on her turf/handicap debut at Newmarket 13 days ago and although down in grade here, she may again find things happening too quickly for her.

horses.breedingComment: E14,000 Y; fifth foal; half-sister to 1m4f AW winner Pour L'Amour (RPR 70); dam multiple 6f-7f winner (Listed placed; RPR 92), half-sister to useful 6f/7f scorer Boldly Goes out of 1m-1m3f winner
horses.sireComment: 6f winner at 2, developed into top sprinter, out of Listed winner; died 2016; first 2yos 2017
horses.diomedComment: Better ground may help, but can't afford to blow the start back down in trip here.
horses.spotlight: Did well last summer with wins at Ayr (6f, good to firm) and York (5f, good to soft); solid efforts in first two starts of this season over 5f-6f at Chester (missed break both times) before possibly finding the soft ground against her at York (6f) three weeks ago; can't afford to blow the start here back down in trip.

horses.breedingComment: 10,000gns F, 65,000gns 2yo; 4th foal; half-sister to winners Bear Faced (7f AW; RPR 94) and Granny Roz (6f; 78); dam 6f-8.6f AW winner (inc at 2; 97), out of once-raced half-sister to US 1m Grade 1 winner Labeeb, is granddaughter of useful 5f 2yo winner
horses.sireComment: champion 2yo in Australia, 4 x G1 winner at 2-3 over 6f; sire of Alizee and Unforgetable Filly
horses.diomedComment: Runner-up on handicap debut at Newcastle seven days ago; conditions no problem.
horses.spotlight: Won her only start as a 2yo at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack) in December and after being outclassed in the Nell Gwyn on her reappearance and undergoing wind surgery, was only just beaten by a subsequent winner under her penalty at Windsor (5f, good to firm) in May; another solid effort when runner-up on handicap debut at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) seven days ago and clear chance off the same mark, with the likely conditions no problem.

horses.breedingComment: 26,000gns Y, E75,000 2yo; 10th foal; half-sister to five winners up to 7f inc Morache Music (6f-7f, inc at 2; 111), Never Lose (6f/7f; 93) and Knight Charm (5f 2yo; 75); dam 1m winner (80), out of 7f 2yo winner
horses.sireComment: high-class 7f at 2, triple Group 1 winning miler at 3, inc Queen Elizabeth II Stakes; good family
horses.diomedComment: More exposed than most, but she is consistent and the conditions will be no problem.
horses.spotlight: Successful in novices over 5f on good ground at Ffos Las and Beverley last September and has made the frame in five of her seven starts since returning in April, including when just beaten in the first-time hood at Bath (5f, good to firm) on her penultimate outing; has developed a habit of missing the break/pulling hard in recent starts and she is more exposed than most, but she is consistent and the conditions will be no problem; every chance.

horses.breedingComment: Third foal; half-sister to Polish 6f-1m winner Shalkar; dam maiden from 1m-1m4f (RPR 57), sister to smart 5.5f-7f winner Hatta Fort, half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Blue Bayou out of 1m1f winner closely related to 1m2f Grade 1 winner Miss Keller
horses.sireComment: Coventry 4th as 2yo; 7f Group 2 winner at 3; won Diamond Jubilee & July Cup at 4; family of Flanders
horses.diomedComment: Not seen since disappointing on handicap debut at Wolverhampton in January; watch market.
horses.spotlight: All four starts on the AW last winter, winning novice events at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack) in December and Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) in January; not seen since disappointing on her handicap debut at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) later that month and market probably the best guide as to what is expected on this turf debut/return.

horses.breedingComment: 35,000gns Nkt July 2016; First foal; 6f winner (inc 2yo/Listed; RPR 96), half-sister to mutiple 1m-1m2f winner Flag Of Glory out of 10.5f winning grand-daughter of high-class older US turf filly Mountain Bear
horses.sireComment: bullet Australian sprinter; champion sire in Australia and top-class source in Europe
horses.diomedComment: Shown little since winning off 5lb higher at Catterick (7f, good to firm) last August.
horses.spotlight: Winner of five races, but shown little since winning off 5lb higher at Catterick (7f, good to firm) last August including when last of six over the same C&D on Monday.

9890631.verdict: A few of these look as though they would prefer an extra furlong but not ENCHANTED LINDAp, a consistent filly who has been running well and will be fine on the ground. Lufricia may benefit from the return to 5f and her stable remains in fine form. She may be next best. [David Bellingham]

keystat.comment: 3yo+ Handicaps at Doncaster have been profitable for favourites (£9.60) over the last five seasons

9890632.diomed: A tight maiden, but IMPERIAL GLORIANA shaped as though this longer trip would suit when a close fourth on her Thirsk debut last month.

horses.breedingComment: 180,000gns Y; third foal; half-brother to winners Plumette (RPR 75) and Swiss Belle (6f AW; 70); dam unplaced 1m/8.6f 2yo maidens (35), sister to 7f/1m 2yo Listed winner Big Audio, is granddaughter of 7f 2yo Group 3 winner, family of Gilt Edge Girl
horses.sireComment: high-class sprint 2yo, r-up in Duke Of York S. at 3, 1/2 to Camacho; excellent source of 2yos
horses.diomedComment: Found a newcomer too good at Newbury last time; solid claims if handling quicker ground.
horses.spotlight: Some promise when seventh of 12 on Newbury debut (6f, good) in May and stepped up on that when only finding a newcomer too good at the same track (6.5f, soft) last month; solid claims if handling the likely quicker ground.

horses.breedingComment: 125,000gns Y; first foal; dam Listed-placed 5f winner (inc at 2; RPR 105,)  out of 7f winning half-sister to 6f Group 1 winner Red Clubs, is granddaughter of 6f Listed winner
horses.sireComment: Unbeaten 2yo, inc Norfolk & Morny; won 5f Grade 3 and runner-up in Breeders' Cup Turf Sprint at 3
horses.diomedComment: Didn't enjoy a clear run when beaten under a length on Newmarket debut a fortnight ago.
horses.spotlight: Didn't enjoy the clearest of runs yet was still beaten less than a length when fourth of seven on his Newmarket debut (6f, good to soft) a fortnight ago; nicely bred and entitled to have come on for that initial effort.

horses.breedingComment: E40,000 Y resold E150,000 Y; first foal; dam placed 5.5f-7f (RPR 75), half-sister to 5f and 5.5f 2yo Group 2 winner Signora Cabello and Group-placed 6f 2yo winner La Presse out of Group-placed 6f 2yo winning half-sister to 5f Group 2 winner Sheer Viking
horses.sireComment: Classy juvenile, won Prix Robert Papin, Flying Childers Stakes & 2nd in Prix Morny; retired at 2
horses.diomedComment: Likeable pedigree, but his three rivals have shown abilty so he will need to be useful.
horses.spotlight: 40,000euros yearling, resold for 150,000euros; dam placed 5.5f-7f (RPR 75), half-sister to 5f and 5.5f 2yo Group 2 winner Signora Cabello and Group-placed 6f 2yo winner La Presse out of Group-placed 6f 2yo winning half-sister to 5f Group 2 winner Sheer Viking; likeable pedigree, but his three rivals have already shown abilty so he will need to be useful to beat them on debut.

horses.breedingComment: Third foal; closely related to 7f winner Ramesses (RPR 77), half-sister to 7f-9.7f winner Borodin (101); dam Listed-placed 1m2f/11.4f winner (103), sister to Group-placed 6f-1m winner Hint Of A Tint, is granddaughter of 7f 2yo Group 3 winner
horses.sireComment: Top-class 2yo, inc Solario Stakes; four time Group 1 winner, Champion 3yo & horse of the year
horses.diomedComment: Beaten half a length when fourth on Thirsk debut last month; longer trip should suit.
horses.spotlight: Only beaten half a length when fourth of 12 on her Thirsk debut (6f, good to soft) last month; slightly longer trip should suit on breeding and very much one to consider.

9890632.raceName: Take Payments Bright Awards Maiden Stakes (5) 2yo
9890632.verdict: A tight maiden despite the small field. Baadirr improved significantly from his debut when second at Newbury last month, while Royal Commando showed plenty of promise on his Newmarket debut a fortnight ago. However, the vote goes to IMPERIAL GLORIANA, who shaped as though this slightly longer trip would be right up her street when a close fourth on last month's Thirsk debut. She can make full use of the 5lb she gets from the colts.[David Bellingham]

keystat.comment: 2yo Non-Handicaps at Doncaster have been profitable for favourites (£12.07) over the last five seasons

9890637.diomed: This looks a good opportunity for GAS MONKEY who is officially 10lb well in having escaped a penalty for his Newbury romp.

horses.breedingComment: 20,000gns Nkt Oct 18; 10th foal; half-brother to winners Daliyra (1m AW; RPR 90) and Daliyan (1m-12.5f inc AW; 78/2m hurdle); dam placed 1m2f-1m4f (81), half-sister to 1m4f Group 1 winner Daliapour and 2m Group 3 winner Dalampour out of 12.5f Gr 2 winner
horses.sireComment: high-class 2yo, won St James's Palace Stakes, 1/2 bro to Ectot; first 2yos 2017
horses.diomedComment: Won at Windsor last August for Richard Hannon, but disappointing over hurdles.
horses.spotlight: Won at Windsor last August (11.4f, good to firm) for Richard Hannon but disappointing in five starts over hurdles for current connections including after wind surgery before latest outing; tongue-tied for this return to the Flat and enough to prove for now.

horses.breedingComment: (2,000 vendor Y); second foal; dam tough 1m-1m4f winner (inc AW; RPR 84), out of 7f 2yo winning sister to 1m2f winner Celtic Truth
horses.sireComment: 1m winner at 2, inc Group 1 2nd; high-class from 3-7, inc Dubai Duty Free; Bated Breath half-brother
horses.diomedComment: 2-2 since hood went on and bolted up at Newbury ten days ago; escapes a penalty for that.
horses.spotlight: 2-2 since the hood went on, including bolting up under Sean Kirrane at Newbury (1m3f, good to soft) ten days ago; escapes a penalty for that and is officially 10lb well-in, so should prove hard to beat despite the longer trip and quicker ground (has run well on good to firm).

horses.breedingComment: Third foal; dam maiden in bumpers/hurdles and points, sister to 2m6f hurdle winner Lyrical Lily, half-sister to smart bumper/2m6f hurdles winner Maybe The Business and bumper/point/2m5f hunter chase winner Mr Collins out of 1m6f Flat/2m hurdles winner.
horses.sireComment: useful 2yo; top-class and robust 1m4f-2m 3-4yo, inc Group 1 St Leger; dual-purpose sire
horses.diomedComment: 2lb below last winning mark, but needs to show more and trip looks a bare minimum for her.
horses.spotlight: Scored twice on good and faster ground at Catterick (1m4f-15.8f) last October and runner-up on her Beverley reappearance (1m4f, good to firm) in April, but she hasn't built on it since including over C&D last Saturday; remains 2lb below her last winning mark but needs to show more and this trip looks a bare minimum for her now.

horses.breedingComment: E5,000 Y; fifth foal; half-brother to Ultimate Warrior, placed 1m2f AW (RPR 72); dam unraced half-sister to 7f winner Moretta Blanche and 6f (inc AW) winner Imperial House out of 6f Listed winner
horses.sireComment: high-class 7f winner at 2, also minor 1m winner at 4 in US; sire of Top Notch Tonto
horses.diomedComment: Winner of 11 races on the AW, but record on turf stands at 1-19.
horses.spotlight: Winner of 11 races on the AW including at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) in May, but record on turf stands at 1-19 and he finished a well-beaten last of seven at Beverley (1m4f, good to soft) ten days ago; races off the same mark and hard to recommend.

horses.breedingComment: E75,000 Y, E8,000 Arqana Dec 18; 5th foal; closely related to 1m2f Group 3 winner Meergorl (RPR 100), half-sister to a winner; dam won in Germany, half-sister to Group-placed 1m winner Meridia and to dam of 1m7f Group 3 winner Moonshiner out of 1m winner
horses.sireComment: top-class over 7-10f at 3-7, also useful 1m winner at 2; leading sire in Germany
horses.diomedComment: 0-7, but twice runner-up from four starts for current yard since arriving from Germany.
horses.spotlight: 0-7, but twice runner-up from four starts for current yard since arriving from Germany, including when beaten less than a length at Windsor (11.4f, good to soft) last month; ran well on faster ground the time before and possibilities off 1lb higher.

horses.breedingComment: 6,500gns Nkt Oct 2018; seventh foal; half-brother to winners Shahah (French 1m 2yo Group 3; RPR 105), Ligeia (6f-1m inc 2yo/AW; 85) and Royal Guinevere (5f-6f; 84); dam unraced half-sister to Dewhurst/St James's Palace winner Grand Lodge
horses.sireComment: Unbeaten champion 2yo, inc National & Dewhurst Stakes; retired due to injury; high-class sire
horses.diomedComment: 0-9 and tends to blow hot and cold, but could be given a chance on some form this year.
horses.spotlight: 0-9 and rather tends to blow hot and cold, but could be given a chance on some of his form this year including when third of 14 off 3lb higher at Windsor (11.4f, good) in April; place possibilities if the first-time cheekpieces help focus him.

horses.breedingComment: E5,000 Y; second foal; half-brother to 9.5f winner Acari (RPR 66); dam unplaced 10.5f in France (81), closely related to 10.5f-1m4f Group 1 winner Aquarelliste and US 1m2f Grade 1 winner Artiste Royale, out of 1m2f Group 3 winner
horses.sireComment: 9f winner at 2; retired after Derby success; sired Derby winner Wings Of Eagles; NH stallion
horses.diomedComment: Both wins have come at around this trip and he is just 1lb above his last winning mark.
horses.spotlight: Didn't see out 14.5f here (good to firm) last month, but both wins have come at around this trip and he is just 1lb above his last winning mark; a sound surface suits him well and not without hope.

horses.breedingComment: E24,000 F, 20,000gns Y; ninth foal; brother to French 2m1f hurdle winner Instagram, half-brother to five French winners inc Russiana (Listed-placed 1m 2yo, stayed 1m2f; RPR 101) and Mombaka (1m6f-2m; 90); dam 1m2f/10.5f Gr 3 winner (stayed 12.5f; 115)
horses.sireComment: top-class miler in France, inc French 2000 Guineas; dual purpose sire
horses.diomedComment: Has been placed six times from eight starts since winning at Thirsk last August.
horses.spotlight: Consistent sort who has been placed six times from eight starts since winning at Thirsk (1m4f, good to soft) last August; handles any ground and likely to run his race, but three handicap wins have come at Class 6 level so he may find a couple too strong.

horses.breedingComment: 7,500gns Nkt Oct 2016; Sixth foal; half-brother to 1m AW winner Gold Falcon (RPR 67); dam 6f 2yo winner (91), sister to fairly useful 6f-7f winner Golden Shaheen and half-sister to Czech Derby winner Cheeky Chappie
horses.sireComment: top-class 2yo, inc Beresford Stakes & Racing Post Trophy; 1m2f Group 3 winning 3yo; dual purpose
horses.diomedComment: 1-20 and 1lb wrong; likely to find this too competitive.
horses.spotlight: Narrowly off the mark at the 19th attempt at Carlisle (1m3f, soft) in May, but could only manage fourth of seven when sent off favourite over the same C&D (good to soft) last month; 1lb out of the handicap and likely to find this too competitive.

9890637.verdict: This looks a good opportunity for GAS MONKEY to complete the hat-trick, with Julia Feilden's gelding officially 10lb well-in having escaped a penalty for his Newbury romp ten days ago. The unexposed Movie Star looks the main threat, though a big run from Mobham wouldn't be a surprise if on a going day.[David Bellingham]

keystat.comment: George Wood is having a decent season at Doncaster (profit of £36.00, 29% strike rate) and rides Movie Star (5:15)

9890633.diomed: This may lie between two old rivals. BINT SOGHAAN (nap) ran well on her return and is weighted to reverse autumn form with Lady Lawyer.

horses.breedingComment: $150,000 Y; first foal; dam US 6.5f AW 2yo winner, half-sister to US 1m1f Grade 2 winner Pulpit and useful 1m3f/2m2f winner Urban Poet out of US Grade 1 2yo 1m winner
horses.sireComment: 7f winner at 2, later outstanding 1m1f-1m2f dirt performer inc. BC Classic; fair young sire
horses.diomedComment: Made a winning debut from Bint Soghaan at Kempton last October; now 7lb worse off.
horses.spotlight: Sent off favourite when making a winning debut at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) last October; had less than a length to spare over runner-up Bint Soghaan and is now 7lb worse off but she could still be anything and is entitled to plenty of respect with Frankie Dettori up.

horses.breedingComment: First foal; unraced dam out of Group-placed 7f winning sister to Group-placed 5f 2yo winner China Eyes and half-sister to 6f Group 1 winner Pipalong and 6f 2yo Listed winner Out Of Africa, is granddaughter of 7f/1m Group 3 winner
horses.sireComment: brilliant sprinter at 2-3, from fast family (dam won Flying Childers); good start with first 2yos
horses.diomedComment: Stable 0-13 with 3yo newcomers since 2011; look elsewhere.
horses.spotlight: Unraced dam out of Group-placed 7f winning sister to Group-placed 5f 2yo winner China Eyes and half-sister to 6f Group 1 winner Pipalong and 6f 2yo Listed winner Out Of Africa, is granddaughter of 7f/1m Group 3 winner; stable 0-13 with 3yo newcomers since 2011; look elsewhere.

horses.breedingComment: 4th live foal; half-sister to winners Tathmeen (5f-6f inc 2yo/AW; RPR 83), Jufn (7f AW 2yo/1m2f turf; 84) and Khobaraa (6f AW 2yo; 82); dam unraced sister to US 1m Grade 3 winner Habaya out of US champion turf female Golden Apples (1m1f-1m2f Gr 1 winner)
horses.sireComment: top-class 2yo, inc Mill Reef & Middle Park Stakes; retired sound at 2; leading sire of sprinters
horses.diomedComment: Runner-up in first two starts including behind Lady Lawyer; chance of going one better.
horses.spotlight: Found only fellow newcomer Lady Lawyer just under a length too good on her debut at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) last October and is now 7lb better off; finished nicely clear of the rest when chasing home an 85-rated rival on her Chepstow return (1m, good) 11 days ago and clear chance of going one better; stable also runs Posted.

horses.breedingComment: E45,000 Y; fifth foal; half-sister to Spanish 7.5f/1m winner Gibralwar; dam placed 1m6f Fibresand claimer (RPR 53), half-sister to 7.5f-1m4f (inc Swedish 8.6f Group 3) winner Plantagenet out of US 6f 2yo stakes winner
horses.sireComment: top-class 6-7f  2yo, inc Group 1 Phoenix Stakes, high-class over 1m at 3; good source of 2yo's
horses.diomedComment: Showed ability on her Ascot debut last September, but quick ground would be a worry.
horses.spotlight: Showed ability when fifth of 12 in on her Ascot debut (6f, good) last September and the form of that race worked out well; extra furlong should suit on pedigree but she was withdrawn due to good to firm ground on her next intended start so quick conditions would be a worry.

horses.breedingComment: 11th foal; half-sister to five winners inc Time On (9.6f-1m4f, inc Gr 2; RPR 111), Raafid (5f-7.5f Fr AW/UAE turf/dirt; 102) and Time Control (1m2f; 77; dam of Cursory Glance); dam 1m and 1m2f (Musidora) winner (113), granddaughter of Time Charter
horses.sireComment: Top-class 2yo, inc Solario Stakes; four time Group 1 winner, Champion 3yo & horse of the year
horses.diomedComment: Just a fair return when fourth at Newbury in May; lacks the scope of a few of these.
horses.spotlight: Seemed sure to win races when runner-up in her first two starts last year at Newbury (6f, good to firm) and Newmarket (7f, good to firm); admittedly highly tried in her last two starts of the season but no more than a fair return when fourth of 12 back at Newbury (7f, good) in May and she lacks the scope of a few of these; stable also runs Bint Soghaan.

horses.breedingComment: E30,000 F; fourth foal; half-sister to US 1m-1m1f turf winner Raging Bull (inc Grade 1; RPR 113); dam Listed-placed French 1m winner (100), half-sister to useful French winners out of French/GB/US 5f-7f winner (inc 5.5f 2yo Group 2)
horses.sireComment: high-class sprinter, excellent sire, can get fast, high-class 2yos, progeny often progress well
horses.diomedComment: Stable 5-27 with 3yo newcomers since 2017; nicely bred filly worth watching in market.
horses.spotlight: 30,000euros foal; half-sister to US 1m-1m1f turf winner Raging Bull (including Grade 1; RPR 113); dam Listed-placed French 1m winner (100), half-sister to useful French winners out of French/GB/US 5f-7f winner (including 5.5f 2yo Group 2); stable 5-27 with 3yo newcomers since 2017 and this nicely bred filly is well worth monitoring in the market.

9890633.verdict: This may lie between two old rivals. Lady Lawyer beat BINT SOGHAAN (nap) by just under a length at Kempton last October, but not only is the latter 7lb better off she also has the benefit of a recent run following her solid return at Chepstow 11 days ago. Those factors should enable her to reverse the form. Posted looked promising in her first couple of starts last year but hasn't built on it.[David Bellingham]

keystat.comment: £11.51: the profit from favourites in 3yo+ Non-Handicaps at Doncaster over the last five seasons.

9890634.diomed: A small field with JALAAD the pick. He represents last year's winning stable and is 1-1 on turf, the win coming over C&D in April.

horses.breedingComment: 7th foal; half-brother to winners Iberis (7f 2yo; RPR 75), Mawjooah (6f AW; 76) & Issue (French 13.5f); dam placed 6f at 2 (68), half-sister to 6f (inc Gimcrack) winner Sir Gerry out of 1m winning half-sister to useful juveniles Staffin and Be Mindful
horses.sireComment: champion 2yo in Australia, 4 x G1 winner at 2-3 over 6f; sire of Alizee and Unforgetable Filly
horses.diomedComment: Has a fine record fresh, so 104-day layoff no worry, but best form has been on Polytrack.
horses.spotlight: Has a fine record fresh so the absence since March isn't a concern but his best form so far has been on Polytrack, including all three wins; others preferred.

horses.breedingComment: 200,000gns Y; second foal; half-brother to 1m AW 2yo winner Booshbash (RPR 62); dam French 1m5f winner, closely related to French 1m6f Listed winner Andry Brusselles, half-sister to 1m Listed winner Mitchum Swagger out of 1m AW Listed winner
horses.sireComment: useful 6-7f; dam won French Oaks; closely related to Invincible Spirit; leading source of speed
horses.diomedComment: C&D winner; respected back on turf for last year's winning stable with a hood given a go.
horses.spotlight: Promising debut at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) last October and made a winning return over this C&D (good) in April; beaten at odds-on under a penalty at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) in May and disappointing when favourite on handicap debut at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) last month, but respected back on turf for last year's winning stable; hood given a go.

horses.breedingComment: (not sold 3,800gns F); first foal; dam unraced half-sister to fairly useful 6f-7f winner Gabrial The Tiger and 5f-7.7f winner Mercers Row out of 1m3f winning granddaughter of Yorkshire Oaks second Blessed Event
horses.sireComment: winner of G3 Jersey Stakes; good source of 2yo winners, sprinters include Sayif and Line Of Reason
horses.diomedComment: Versatile sort, but has 3lb to find with two of these so looks set for a supporting role.
horses.spotlight: Versatile sort, having raced over trips ranging from 6f to 9.5f this year on turf/AW; comes into this after two good runs at Brighton, but has 3lb to find with a couple of these so may have to settle for a supporting role.

horses.breedingComment: 26,000gns Y; 9th foal; half-brother to six winners inc Market Day (6f/7f 2yo AW, later US 1m turf stakes winner; RPR 102), Wild Rose (1m-1m4f AW; 96) and Arabian Heights (9.4f AW; 89); dam unraced half-sister to 1m2f-1m4f winner Zuiider Zee
horses.sireComment: high-class & tough 2yo, inc Group 3; won Group 1 Prix Jean Prat at 3; speedy family
horses.diomedComment: Had a purple patch on fast ground around this time last year; not one to take lightly.
horses.spotlight: Was in the middle of a purple patch on fast ground this time last year, completing a four-timer with two wins at Carlisle (6f) and two at Redcar (7f); a couple of his performances this year suggest the ability remains and has to be respected should the ground remain quick.

9890634.verdict: Preference in this four-runner contest is for JALAAD, who represents last year's winning stable and is 1-1 on turf, that win coming over C&D in April. Whinmoor was in cracking form on fast ground this time last year and it wouldn't be a surprise to see him bounce back at some point. He may be next best. [David Bellingham]

keystat.comment: £19.16 profit when Kevin Stott rides for Saeed bin Suroor (Jalaad) this season

9890635.diomed: Tamreer is thrown in on her recent Listed-race form, but ARCTIC OCEAN looks to be improving judged on her recent Beverley success.

horses.breedingComment: 8,000gns Nkt Dec 18; First foal; dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (stayed 1m2f; RPR 102), half-sister to 1m/1m2f winner Kaafel out of unraced half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Muhtathir and useful 7f-1m winner Jawla, is granddaughter of 1m 2yo Gr 3 winner
horses.sireComment: five-time Gr1 winner over 7-12f at 2-3; excellent young sire incl Dawn Approach, Masar and Talent
horses.diomedComment: Ran a blinder when third in a Listed race at Pontefract 12 days ago; due an 11lb rise.
horses.spotlight: Progressive form in handicaps in the spring prior to regaining winning ways at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) early last month; ran a blinder at the weights when third of eight in a Listed race at Pontefract (1m4f, good) 12 days ago and is already due an 11lb rise for that; Pattern-race form not always completely reliable back in handicaps but clearly has a major chance if able to reproduce anything like that level of performance.

horses.breedingComment: First foal; dam 1m4f Flat (RPR 80)/fairly useful 2m hurdle winner, half-sister to 1m4f Flat/2m hurdle winner Clowance House and 1m1f Flat/2m hurdle winner Laugharne out of Group-placed 1m2f winner
horses.sireComment: Won Racing Post Trophy at two; champion 3yo, inc Guineas, Derby & Irish Derby; top sire
horses.diomedComment: Should enjoy the return to quick ground, but a couple of others have stronger credentials.
horses.spotlight: Showed promise in first three starts over 1m-1m2f before making a successful handicap debut at Leicester (11.8f, good to firm) in May (Arctic Ocean third); appeared to get stuck in the mud when beaten a long way at Haydock (1m6f, heavy) last month and should enjoy the return to quick ground, but a couple of the others have stronger credentials.

horses.breedingComment: $57,000 Y; third foal; half-sister to US winners Stella B (1m dirt 2yo) and Bella's Eye (6f AW); dam placed US 1m turf, out of US champion older mare (8.5f-1m1f Grade 1 winner), is granddaughter of Group-placed 7f 2yo winner
horses.sireComment: top-class winner on turf over 10-12f in US, from good Eur. family; good young sire inc. of V E Day
horses.diomedComment: Seemed to be caught out by the lack of pace at Windsor last time; cheekpieces given a go .
horses.spotlight: Appreciated the half-mile step up in trip when off the mark in a novice at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) in April, but appeared to be caught out by the lack of pace when third of four at Windsor (11.4f, good to firm) last time; cheekpieces given a go (has worn blinkers), but will need a good pace to run at.

horses.breedingComment: 130,000gns Y; second foal; half-sister to 6f-7f winner Brother Bear (inc at 2/Listed; RPR 106); dam unraced half-sister to 6f 2yo Listed winner King Hesperus out of US 8.5f minor stakes winning half-sister to French 2,000 second Noble Minstrel
horses.sireComment: Won Racing Post Trophy at two; champion 3yo, inc Guineas, Derby & Irish Derby; top sire
horses.diomedComment: Taken time to come to herself, but Beverley success 17 days ago suggests she is improving.
horses.spotlight: Taken a bit of time to come to herself and has work to do in order to reverse May's Leicester form with Dorah on 1lb worse terms, but her Beverley success (1m4f, good) 17 days ago suggests she may have improved in the meantime; stable won this in 2016; may be the answer.

9890635.raceName: Betfair Exchange British EBF Fillies' Handicap (0-85) (4) 3yo+
9890635.verdict: The main question is whether Tamreer can repeat her third in a Pontefract Listed race 12 days ago on this return to handicap company because she is thrown in if she can. However, this race has been dominated by 3yos in recent years and although ARCTIC OCEAN looks to be up against it in attempting to reverse May's Leicester running with Dorah, her recent Beverley win suggests she may have improved since then as the stable's runners often do.[David Bellingham]

keystat.comment: This season, Tom Marquand (Eesha My Flower) is showing a profit of £38.51

9890636.diomed: Not a competitive race by any means. PROMISSORY made such a promising debut at Goodwood in May and looks to have plenty more to offer.

horses.breedingComment: 7,000 Don Jan 2019; first foal; dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (RPR 98), half-sister to six useful winners inc Green Coast (7f), Dubai Fashion (8.5f) and Famous Warrior (6f-1m2f) out of Italian 1m Group 2 winner from family of Nashwan
horses.sireComment: Unbeaten champion 2yo, inc National & Dewhurst Stakes; retired due to injury; high-class sire
horses.diomedComment: Dual bumper winner in the spring and runner-up in a Goodwood maiden a fortnight ago.
horses.spotlight: Unraced for Godolphin; dual bumper winner on good ground in the spring and made a fine Flat debut when runner-up in a Goodwood maiden (1m6f, good) a fortnight ago; some speed in his pedigree, so the shorter trip shouldn't be an issue on this more galloping track, but he may again have to play second fiddle to a Gosden-trained 3yo.

horses.breedingComment: 220,000gns F, 725,000gns Y, 2,000gns Nkt Oct 2018; first foal; dam 11.7f winner (RPR 93), sister to 1m4f AW Flat/2m3f chase winner Theturnofthesun, half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Raymi Coya, is granddaughter of US 1m1f Grade 1 winner
horses.sireComment: Champion 2yo; hugely talented 3yo, inc French Guineas & Derby; family of Street Cry; excellent sire
horses.diomedComment: Bumper winner in March, but pulled up in Aintree bumper and well beaten on Flat debut.
horses.spotlight: Unraced for Sir Michael Stoute; made a winning debut in a Stratford bumper in March before pulling up in the Grade 2 bumper at Aintree; little impression on this 4yo's Flat debut at Windsor (1m2f, soft) last month and although the return to a sound surface may help and he has undergone wind surgery since last seen, he still has plenty to prove.

horses.breedingComment: E1,800 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to point winner Guidelines; dam well beaten in 1m maidens, half-sister to 2m4f and 2m6f hurdle winner Hey Bob out of 7f-1m1f winner
horses.sireComment: high-class middle-distance colt, inc Hardwicke Stakes & King George; from top family; NH sire
horses.diomedComment: Twice placed over hurdles last year, but well beaten since including on Flat debut.
horses.spotlight: Twice placed over hurdles at around 2m4f last year, but then twice well beaten over jumps and also on his Flat debut/reappearance at Wetherby (1m2f, good) in May; hard to fancy.

horses.breedingComment: 5,000gns Nkt July 2018; 6th foal; brother to winners Deauville (7f-1m2f inc at 2/US Gr 1; RPR 121), The Corsican (1m2f-1m4f inc AW/Group 3; 118) & Heatstroke (1m AW 2yo; 89) closely related to Swedish 6f 2yo winner Absolute Soul; dam 5f-1m1f winner (98)
horses.sireComment: champion 3yo colt, inc Derby, Irish Derby & King George; from outstanding family; phenomenal sire
horses.diomedComment: Well held in two bumpers earlier in the year and also in two starts on the Flat.
horses.spotlight: Well held in two bumpers earlier in the year and also in two starts on the Flat at around 1m2f on fast and easy ground; cheekpieces need to have a dramatic effect.

horses.breedingComment: (not sold 9,500gns F); third foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 83), half-sister to three minor winners up to 7f out of half-sister to 6f Group 1 winner Malhub, is granddaughter of 7f Listed winner
horses.sireComment: champion in Aus/Europe, 10xG1 winner inc. Eclipse S. & Cox Plate; first 2yos 2016
horses.diomedComment: 250-1 when beaten out of sight in one start for Trevor Wall at Nottingham last August.
horses.spotlight: Sent off at 250-1 when beaten out of sight in one start for Trevor Wall at Nottingham (1m, good) last August.

horses.breedingComment: (14,000gns vendor F); first foal; dam unraced sister to 1m3f winner Straight Laced, out of sister to useful 1m2f-1m4f winner Mary Stuart and half-sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner Bonny Scot and to the dam of Golan
horses.sireComment: smart 12f colt at 3-4 in Fr, later G1 winner in US/Canada, brother to Dansili; good young sire
horses.diomedComment: Tailed off having missed the break on his Sandown debut last month.
horses.spotlight: Tailed off having missed the break on his Sandown debut (1m2f, good to soft) last month; big leap of faith required to support him.

horses.breedingComment: Third foal; half-sister to 1m-8.5f winner The Revenant (inc GB 2yo/German Group 2; RPR 112); dam 7f-1m4f winner (inc at 2/Group 3; 111), half-sister to Italian 1m3f Listed winner Leo Gali, is granddaughter of 7f 2yo winner who stayed 1m6f
horses.sireComment: Top-class 2yo, inc Solario Stakes; four time Group 1 winner, Champion 3yo & horse of the year
horses.diomedComment: Looked to need the experience when well beaten on her Chelmsford debut last month.
horses.spotlight: Looked to need the experience when well beaten on her Chelmsford debut (1m2f, Polytrack) last month; bred to be much better than that so no surprise were she to take a step forward but she will need to.

horses.breedingComment: 1,100,000gns Y; first foal; dam 1m3f-1m4f winner (inc AW/Group 1; RPR 118), half-sister to 15.5f Listed winner Gale Force and Group-placed 6f-7f winner Instance out of 1m winning half-sister to 7.4f Group 3 winner Hamairi, family of Harzand
horses.sireComment: unbeaten 2yo, inc National Stakes; won Irish Guineas & Jacques le Marois at 3; exceptional sire
horses.diomedComment: Caught the eye when third on her Goodwood debut in May; second and fourth have won since.
horses.spotlight: Beautifully bred, being a 1,100,000gns daughter of the 1m4f Group 1 winner Seal Of Approval; well held by the first two but still caught the eye when third of 11 on her Goodwood debut (1m2f, good) in May; second and fourth from that race have won since and a Group 2 entry at Goodwood next month suggests she is held in some regard; the one to beat.

9890636.raceName: Martyn Baldwin 60th Birthday Party Novice Stakes (4) 3yo+
9890636.verdict: Not a competitive race by any means. Dual bumper winner December Second made a fine Flat debut when chasing home a Gosden-trained 3yo at Goodwood last month, but a similar scenario probably awaits as PROMISSORY made such a promising debut at the same track in May. This Group 2-entered filly looks to have plenty more to offer.[David Bellingham]

keystat.comment: Laura Coughlan (I Think So) is showing a profit of £53.25 this season
